entries.content: When facing an objection like 'you can't sell X', challenge the generic statement.
Isolate the objection: If the generic objection is challenged, it might be modified to 'you can't sell X in our world'. Challenge this too.
Guide the prospect (or yourself) to identify the personal root cause of the perceived objection: 'I can't sell X'.
entries.notes: Shifting from external market constraint to internal skill/ability.

entries.content: Once the root cause is identified as a personal inability ('I can't'), you can start dealing with the actual problem.
Recognize that 'you can't sell X' is often a reflection of 'I can't sell X' due to lack of skill or approach.

focus_area: Objection Discovery: Clarifying questions, isolation, root cause
